newsitem.title: ITALY: Caspian Sea group selects 12 high potential blocks.
newsitem.headline: Caspian Sea group selects 12 high potential blocks.

text.p: The Caspian Sea Consortium completed all its seismic survey and data interpretation operations aimed at identifying the oil and gas potential of the Kazak sector of the Caspian Sea, a statement from Italy's Agip SpA said.
The consortium groups Agip, the BP /Statoil alliance, British Gas, Mobil Corp, Royal Dutch/Shell, Total SA and Kazakstancaspishelf (KCS).
These operations enabled the partners to select 12 high potential blocks for which negotiations on a production sharing agreement are now underway with the Republic of Kazakstan.
The consortium had already announced in August 1996 the successful completion of the geophysical survey.
When the production sharing agreement on the 12 selected blocks is signed it will be followed by drilling operations, the statement added.
